Package imagingbook.lib.util.choice

Interface Choices

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExampleWithChoices, ExampleWithChoices.ChoiceA, ExampleWithChoices.ChoiceB, ExampleWithChoices.ChoiceC
    public interface Choices
    This is the core of a scheme to collect and instantiate dedicated subclasses ("choices") of a given class or interface.

    The traditional scheme (see ExampleTraditional) requires the following steps:

    1. Define a superclass (or interface) with a set of nested, concrete subclasses that are to be instantiated after being chosen by the user.
    2. Available choices are specified by an enum type, which maps to the associated subclasses.
    3. Dispatching (i.e., dynamic instantiation of choices) is done by a switch over all enum-values or by the enum elements themselves.

    The proposed scheme (see ExampleWithChoices) works as follows:

    1. Define a superclass (or interface) with a set of nested, concrete subclasses that are to be instantiated after being chosen by the user.
    2. Selected subclasses are marked with a DeclareChoice annotation. To be accepted as a choice, a subclass must fulfill the following requirements:
      • The subclass definition must be static, so it can be instantiated without a containing class instance.
      • The subclass must extend its containing class.
      • The subclass must carry a DeclareChoice annotation. A runtime exception may occur if a subclass is annotated but does not satisfy the above requirements.
    3. Static methods defined in Choices allow listing and instantiation of the defined choices in a given containing class. There is no need for a separate enum type.

    A descriptive name (String) for the choice item may be passed to the DeclareChoice annotation, which my be retrieved at runtime with getChoiceName(Class).

    This is defined as an interface to be implemented by enclosing classes (with additional functionality) in the future. Note that this code is still experimental!

    See ExampleWithChoices for a simple usage example:

    Version:
    2020/11/03

    • Method Detail

      • getChoices

        static <E> java.lang.Class<? extends E>[] getChoices​(java.lang.Class<E> outerClass)
        Searches the specified class or interface for inner classes marked as 'choices' by a DeclareChoice annotation. An array of subclasses is returned, which may be empty.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the containing class (or interface)
        Parameters:
        outerClass - the class (or interface) containing the choice subclasses
        Returns:
        array of subclasses, which may be empty

      • isChoice

        static boolean isChoice​(java.lang.Class<?> choiceClass)
        Checks if the specified class is a choice class.
        Parameters:
        choiceClass - the potential choice class
        Returns:
        true if a choice class

      • isChoice

        static boolean isChoice​(java.lang.Class<?> enclosingClass,
                        java.lang.Class<?> choiceClass)
        Checks if the specified class is a choice class within the given enclosing class.
        Parameters:
        enclosingClass - the enclosing class
        choiceClass - the potential (inner) choice class
        Returns:
        true if a choice class

      • hasConstructor

        static <E> boolean hasConstructor​(java.lang.Class<E> clazz)

      • getChoiceName

        static <E> java.lang.String getChoiceName​(java.lang.Class<E> choiceClass)
        Returns the name of a specified single choice class. The result is its simple class name or the descriptive name specified by the associated DeclareChoice annotation. Throws a runtime exception if the specified class is not a choice class.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the choice class
        Parameters:
        choiceClass - the choice class
        Returns:
        the (optional) descriptive name specified by the associated DeclareChoice annotation, otherwise the simple name of the class.

      • getChoiceNames

        static <E> java.lang.String[] getChoiceNames​(java.lang.Class<E> outerClass)
        Returns an array of choice names (see getChoiceName(Class)) for the specified containing class.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the generic type of the containing class
        Parameters:
        outerClass - the choice class
        Returns:
        an array of choice names

      • getChoiceForName

        static <E> java.lang.Class<? extends E> getChoiceForName​(java.lang.Class<E> outerClass,
                                                         java.lang.String name)

      • getInstance

        static <E> E getInstance​(java.lang.Class<? extends E> choiceClass)
        Creates and returns a new instance of the specified choice class. Throws a runtime exception if the specified class is not a choice class.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the generic type of the enclosing class
        Parameters:
        choiceClass - the choice class
        Returns:
        a new instance
